measured_by: goal-perseverance paradigm (persistence toward the originally intended but now sub-optimal destination after deliberate disruption)
justification: “We adopted the ‘goal perseverance’ paradigm to measure intentional commitment… Commitment is measured by whether the agent would still pursue the originally intended but now sub-optimal destination after the deliberate disruption.”

measured_by: Bayesian Theory of Mind (BToM) posterior inference over action trajectories
justification: “To explore how the presence of others impacted the dynamic process of intention formation, we applied a Bayesian Theory of Mind (BToM) model to infer human’s intention from their actions using data from all trials.”

measured_by: percentage of trials in which participants reached a different destination than the co-player
justification: “Across all trials, the ‘conflict avoidance’ results showed that participants chose a different destination from the MDP-AI in 70.2% of the trials… predicting the likelihood of reaching different destinations.”
